site.title: Ameto
site.description: Ameto is a visual CMS that makes it a blast to build pages, manage content, and edit code - one block at a time.

heading.html: Primo is a visual CMS that makes it a blast to build pages, manage content, and edit code - one block at a time.
heading.markdown: Primo is a visual CMS that makes it a blast to build **pages**, manage **content**, and edit **code** \- one block at a time.

sections.heading: Welcome to a better way to build websites

body.html: Build your site's pages by dragging and dropping your blocks directly onto the page, unencumbered by overwhelming design options.
body.markdown: Build your site's pages by dragging and dropping your blocks directly onto the page, unencumbered by overwhelming design options.

body.html: Update your text, images, and links directly on the page or open up the Fields view to manage your content from a structured view.
body.markdown: Update your text, images, and links directly on the page or open up the Fields view to manage your content from a structured view.

body.html: Access each block's code with a click - right from your browser. And since each block is a Svelte component, there's no limit to what you can make.
body.markdown: Access each block's code with a click - right from your browser. And since each block is a [Svelte](https://svelte.dev) component, there's no limit to what you can make.

sections.subheading: Primo combines delightful content management with the power of modern development

description.html: Your websites are secure, scalable to millions, and fast-loading - no fancy plugins necessary.
description.markdown: Your websites are secure, scalable to millions, and fast-loading - no fancy plugins necessary.

description.html: Invite any number of collaborators as developers or content editors and edit your pages together.
description.markdown: Invite any number of collaborators as developers or content editors and edit your pages together.

description.html: Create an unlimited number of websites on a single server and start new sites in seconds.
description.markdown: # Create an unlimited number of websites on a single server and start new sites in seconds.

description.html: Deploy your site to a Github repository. From there you can easily deploy it to any web host.
description.markdown: # Deploy your site to a Github repository. From there you can easily deploy it to any web host.

description.html: Hit the ground running with one of Primo's free themes and customize it in seconds using CSS variables.
description.markdown: Hit the ground running with one of Primo's free themes and customize it in seconds using CSS variables.

description.html: Access a growing library of pre-built blocks which automatically adapt to your site's design.
description.markdown: Access a growing library of pre-built blocks which automatically adapt to your site's design.

description.html: All of your page blocks are written with Svelte - so they're reactive, their styles are encapsulated, and they're basically just HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
description.markdown: All of your page blocks are written with Svelte - so they're reactive, their styles are encapsulated, and they're basically just HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

description.html: Easily manage content for over 60 locales and build each as a static version so you can rule your SEO.
description.markdown: Easily manage content for over 60 locales and build each as a static version so you can rule your SEO.

description.html: Fetch your site's content directly from your server using a REST API. Currently in Alpha.
description.markdown: Fetch your site's content directly from your server using a REST API. Currently in Alpha.

description.html: Every time you publish, a simple JSON file gets deployed with your site that can be used to restore your site in an instant.
description.markdown: Every time you publish, a simple JSON file gets deployed with your site that can be used to restore your site in an instant.

description.html: Primo uses PostCSS under the hood to enable nested styles and auto-prefix your CSS so it stays neat and tidy.
description.markdown: Primo uses PostCSS under the hood to enable nested styles and auto-prefix your CSS so it stays neat and tidy.

description.html: Import JavaScript libraries without needing to install them first. Primo bundles your dependencies with Rollup, so you don't have to worry about things breaking in production.
description.markdown: Import JavaScript libraries without needing to install them first. Primo bundles your dependencies with Rollup, so you don't have to worry about things breaking in production.

body.html: Set up your own Primo server in under 5 minutes and manage unlimited sites with ease. Don't want to manage your own server? Try Primo Cloud for free.
body.markdown: # Set up your own Primo server in under 5 minutes and manage unlimited sites with ease. Don't want to manage your own server? Try Primo Cloud for free.

sections.heading: Spin up speedy, secure, scalable static sites in seconds.

items.title: Is Primo open-core? VC-funded open source? Side project?

description.html: Primo is MIT licensed, under full-time development, and is in the process of moving under a nonprofit organization. Any funds generated from White Glove and Cloud will go towards funding further development, in the same vein as Ghost CMS.
description.markdown: Primo is [MIT licensed](https://github.com/primocms/primo/blob/master/LICENSE),  under full-time development, and is in the process of moving under a nonprofit organization. Any funds generated from White Glove and Cloud will go towards funding further development, in the same vein as [Ghost CMS](https://ghost.org).

items.title: How does this compare to WordPress?

description.html: WordPress has been around for a while, but over that time it's built up a lot of baggage. Primo takes a simpler approach that's easier to spin up & manage. Primo lets you manage any number of sites from a single server (instead of needing to run a server per website), builds static sites by default, and gives you direct access to your site's code.
description.markdown: WordPress has been around for a while, but over that time it's built up a lot of baggage. Primo takes a simpler approach that's easier to spin up & manage. Primo lets you manage any number of sites from a single server (instead of needing to run a server per website), builds static sites by default, and gives you direct access to your site's code.

items.title: Can I use Primo with SvelteKit? Next, Nuxt, Astro?

description.html: You can use Primo headless by consuming your Primo site's data from your favorite framework, or serve generated Primo pages from SvelteKit.
description.markdown: You can [use Primo headless](https://docs.primocms.org/guides/how-to-use-primo-headless) by consuming your Primo site's data from your favorite framework, or [serve generated Primo pages from SvelteKit](https://docs.primocms.org/guides/how-to-serve-primo-pages-from-sveltekit).

items.title: How far along is Primo's development?

description.html: Primo has been in full-time development for three years. It entered the public beta of version 2 in June of 2023 and is stable enough for personal projects.
description.markdown: Primo has been in full-time development for three years. It entered the public beta of version 2 in June of 2023 and is stable enough for personal projects.

items.title: How much will it cost to host or use Primo?

description.html: You can host your own Primo server on a modern web host like Vercel, Netlify, or Render, use Supabase as backend, and deploy your sites to Github and the same web host. Since all those services have generous free tiers, you can publish a whole lot of sites and only pay for the domain names.
description.markdown: You can [host your own Primo server](https://docs.primocms.org/getting-started) on a modern web host like [Vercel](https://vercel.com), [Netlify](https://netlify.com), or [Render](https://render.com), use [Supabase](https://supabase.com) as backend, and deploy your sites to [Github](https://github.com) and the same web host. Since all those services have generous free tiers, you can publish a whole lot of sites and only pay for the domain names.

subheading.html:
• Using it headless alongside SvelteKit, NextJS, etc.

  • Design fields to give content editors predefined style options.

  • Cloud functions for writing backend code from Primo.
subheading.markdown:
- **Using it headless** alongside SvelteKit, NextJS, etc.

- **Design fields** to give content editors predefined style options.

- **Cloud functions** for writing backend code from Primo.
